Critics costly federal farm programs maintain government could get guaranteeing minimum support prices farmers systematically used options contracts protect vacillating market prices. "With agricultural options available, less need government price support programs provide price stability farmers," Heritage Foundation, conservative think tank, said recent position paper. "Washington longer needs restrict level variability commodity market prices. Farmers others agribusiness achieve benefits price stability trading option markets," paper, written Clemson University professor Kandice Kahl, said. Critics farm programs contend options offer benefits price support programs without entailing cost taxpayers. Kahl's paper urged farmers buy "put" options order obtain right sell particular price private seller option contract. "This gives farmer guaranteed price, still allows profit higher market prices, available, foregoing option," Kahl said. Interest promoting understanding options trading among farmers also stirred Congress proposed change agricultural policy would effect exposing participants federal farm programs fluctuations income subsidies. proposal -- supported Reagan administration cross-section lawmakers -- would allow farmers receive least 92 pct income subsidies regardless much planted. current law, farmers enrolled federal price stabilization programs receive income subsidies, deficiency payments, equal difference set target price higher support price market price. so-called decoupling plan, "0/92", would aim curtail surplus production eliminating requirement farmers plant order receive deficiency payments. Critics "0/92" plan contend scheme succeeded curbing surplus output, market prices would rise deficiency payments fall -- leaving farmers chose plant shrunken income subsidies crops sell. Sen. Rudy Boschwitz (R-Minn.), forefront efforts decouple income support acreage plantings, advocates replacing variable deficiency payment fixed gradually declining payment. many farm state lawmakers turned idea offering fixed subsidies farmers plant nothing. congressional staff members said intrigued notion federal government subsidize purchase "call" options help farmers hedge income risk. buying call option, farmer would obtain right buy commodity particular price. market price rose option price, farmer could exercise option sell commodity spot market, making reduction deficiency payment. aide Boschwitz said senator might offer legislation linking options decoupling, might await results pilot project futures options trading mandated 1985 farm bill. bill required USDA, association Commodity Futures Trading Commission, conduct pilot program least 40 counties produce major program crops. program, recently launched, designed encourage producers participate futures options markets ensure producers' net returns would fall county loan level crops question. <TITLE>BRAZIL'S FUNARO WINS PROMISES EUROPE TRIP</TITLE> <DATELINE> LONDON, March 6 - </DATELINE><BODY>Brazilian Finance Minister Dilson Funaro last night concluded week's tour European capitals gleaned little way concrete support governments country's attempts find radical solution debt payments crisis. However, banking sources noted existence considerable sympathy Brazil's position among commercial bank creditors, manifested widespread belief adopting hard line could exacerbate problems patience might pave way eventual reconciliation. Brazil February 20 unilaterally suspended interest payments 68 billion dlr debt commercial banks, followed moves related around 15 billion dlrs bank trade credit lines deposited foreign banks institutions. action preceded significant deterioration Brazil's balance payments situation final quarter 1986, along marked acceleration inflation. Reserves dipped four billion dlrs. Funaro central bank president Francisco Gros last week visited Washington explain Brazil's move government officials agencies. week sought official support U.K., France, Germany, Switzerland Italy. decided extend tour, flying Sunday Tokyo talk government officials, possible visit Canada return home. Funaro Gros far confined consultations government representatives, believing problems Brazil's 109 billion dlr debt call political solution. U.S. non-farm payroll employment rose 337,000 February, twice financial markets expected. follows 319,000 gain January, revised previously reported 448,000 increase. "Even look January February together, still much stronger report consensus expectation market," said Allan Leslie Discount Corporation. Economists stressed gains hours worked signal much larger gains February U.S. production income previously forecast. average work week rose 0.2 hours 35.0 hours 34.8 hours January. average manufacturing work week rose 0.3 hours 41.2 hours, longest factory work week since November 1966, Commerce Department said. "The gains manufacturing employment point large increase industrial production 0.5 0.7 pct," said Joe Carson Chemical Bank. compares 0.4 pct gain January U.S. industrial production. Peter Greenbaum Smith Barney Harris Upham Co Inc noted average wage rate increased 8.87 dlrs hour February 8.83 dlrs January. "Combined increase hours worked, means we'll get pretty healthy gain personal income vis-a-vis wage salary disbursement," said. Greenbaum said February U.S. personal income rise least 0.5 pct flat January. said February employment gains consistent firm's first quarter U.S. real gross national product growth forecast 3.7 pct. Economists agreed employment data negative credit markets signal healthier economy easing Federal Reserve's monetary policy. said market need fear tighter policy either. "This report another reason Fed consider easing," said Ray Stone Merrill Lynch Capital Markets Inc. "It gives room address dollar situation," said. "If nudge policy tighter, could so, likely they'll sit wait." "The data uniform," Stone added. "Durable goods weak January employment strong." January, U.S. durable goods orders dropped 7.5 pct, followed 4.0 pct drop U.S. factory goods orders. U.S. retail sales fell 5.8 pct, U.S. merchandise trade gap widened 14.8 billion dlrs. "Things adding up," said Steve Slifer Lehman Goverment Securities Inc. "Consumer spending, capital spending, goverment spending, net exports data show weak first quarter GNP growth one pct," said. "The employment production data point big inventory build-up, that's thought fourth quarter got 1.3 pct GNP growth." Manufacturing employment gained 50,000 falling 15,000 January. Economists estimated 30,000 gain accounted striking workers steel machinery industries returning work. Even so, economists said manufacturing gains resulted improving trade outlook. Jason Benderly Goldman, Sachs Co noted U.S. trade picture improved fourth quarter net exports grew 20 pct annual rate rate increase imports fell six pct, continues improve first quarter. "Not official statistics fourth quarter, evidence pick orders overseas paper products, chemicals, high-tech goods, capital goods show trade improving," Benderley said. "The economy moving extremes," said. "Some reports going look bad good, first quarter GNP going grow middle three pct." 287,000 gain services employment comprised greater part February's employment gain. Retail services employment rose 129,000 February, compared gain 117,000 January, previously reported 166,000. Construction employment rose slim 2,000 February. follows robust 113,000 gain January, revised previously reported 142,000 gain. U.S. civilian unemployment rate unchanged February 6.7 pct. means jobless rate stayed 6.7 pct three consecutive months, lowest reading since March 1980, Commerce Department noted. "The Federal Reserve pleased report," Carson said. "This takes away Fed's flexibility ease, there's reason tighten. way early that." M-1-A, M-1 plus daily interest chequable non-personal deposits, rose 556 mln dlrs 75.19 billion dlrs M-2, M-1-A plus notice personal fixed-term deposit rose 651 mln dlrs 176.87 billion dlrs.s M-3, non-personal fixed term deposits foreign currency deposits residents booked chartered banks Canada, rose 992 mln dlrs 216.03 billion dlrs. Chartered bank general loans outstanding rose 481 mln dlrs 124.99 billion dlrs. Canadian liquid plus short term assets fell 854 mln dlrs 35.40 billion dlrs total Canadian dollar major assets chartered banks fell 118 mln dlrs 221.20 billion dlrs. Chartered bank net foreign currency assets fell 23 mln dlrs minus 1.92 billion dlrs. Notes circulation totalled 16.24 billion dlrs, 76 mln dlrs week before. February 20 Brazilian government suspended interest payments part huge foreign debt following sharp deterioration trade balance. Today government faced fresh problem, petrol station owners Sao Paulo, country's industrial heartland, three states closed press higher fuel prices. fears combination two stoppages could lead serious fuel shortage. seamen's leaders say strike halted 48 72 ships belonging state oil company Petrobras. Jornal Brasil newspaper, editorial today entitled "Dangerous Confrontation," said: "From economic point view seamen's strike carries alarming cost, grave consequences supply situation country's external trade." seamen seeking 275 pct pay rise rejected offers 100 pct. Later today Higher Labour Tribunal Brasilia due rule whether seamen's strike legal. senior official National Merchant Marine Union, Jorge Luis Leao Franco, told Reuters strike would continue regardless tribunal's ruling. Labour unrest worsened Brazil following collapse last months government's Cruzado Plan price freeze. Prices rising 15 pct month. workers also businessmen restive. Petrol station owners said many garages closed indefinitely today Sao Paulo, Parana, Mato Grosso Mato Grosso Sul.
